channel.title: Advent of Code
channel.description:
I saw this posted on R-S, so why not have our own thread? Check it out [url=http://adventofcode.com/]here[/url].
Let's see who can make it through all 25 days! Don't post solutions here unless they were from a previous day and are in spoiler tags.

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

day 22 was fun I just sort of winged it rather than making the code solve the best simulation I instead just changed my player attack styles until it worked
[spoiler]

public class DayTwentyTwo {

    private final Entity player;
    private final Entity enemy;

    public DayTwentyTwo() {
        this.player = new Player(50, 500, 0, 0);
        this.enemy = new Boss(71, 0, 10, 0); //puzzle input
    }

    public static void main(String args[]) {
        DayTwentyTwo day = new DayTwentyTwo();
        day.simulateBattle(false);

    }

    public void simulateBattle(boolean hardMode) {
        Battle b = new Battle(new Player(player.getHealth(), player.getMana(), player.getDamage(), player.getArmour()), new Boss(enemy.getHealth(), enemy.getMana(), enemy.getDamage(), enemy.getArmour()));
        while (b.getPlayer().health > 0 && enemy.getHealth() > 0) {
            for (Entity e : b.getEntities()) {
                if (hardMode) {
                    b.getPlayer().setHealth(b.getPlayer().getHealth() - 1);
                }
                b.getActiveSpells().forEach(s -> {
                    s.onTick(b);
                });
                b.getActiveSpells().removeIf(s -> s.getTick() == 0);

                e.attack(b);

            }
            System.out.println("Round: " + b.getPlayer().getHealth() + " " + b.getEnemy().getHealth() + " Mana used: " + player.getManaUsage());
        }
    }

    public class Battle {

        private final Entity player;
        private final Entity enemy;
        private final ArrayList<Spell> activeSpells;

        public Battle(Entity player, Entity enemy) {
            this.player = player;
            this.enemy = enemy;
            this.activeSpells = new ArrayList<Spell>();
        }

        public Entity getPlayer() {
            return player;
        }

        public Entity getEnemy() {
            return enemy;
        }

        public ArrayList<Spell> getActiveSpells() {
            return activeSpells;
        }

        private Entity[] getEntities() {
            return new Entity[]{player, enemy};
        }

    }

    public class Player extends Entity {

        private int manaUsage;

        public Player(int health, int mana, int damage, int armour) {
            super(health, mana, damage, armour);
            this.manaUsage = 0;
        }

        @Override
        public void attack(Battle b) {
            Spell s = null;
            //change attack methods to find best usage
            if (find(b.getActiveSpells(), Shield.class) == null) {
                s = new Shield();
            } else if (find(b.getActiveSpells(), Poison.class) == null) {
                s = new Poison();
            }
            if (s == null) {
                return;
            }
            s.cast(b);
            this.manaUsage += s.getManaCost();
        }

    }

    public static <T> T find(Collection<?> arrayList, Class<T> clazz) {
        for (Object o : arrayList) {
            if (o != null && o.getClass() == clazz) {
                return clazz.cast(o);
            }
        }

        return null;
    }

    public class Boss extends Entity {

        public Boss(int health, int mana, int damage, int armour) {
            super(health, mana, damage, armour);
        }

        @Override
        public void attack(Battle b) {
            b.getPlayer().setHealth(b.getPlayer().getHealth() - (this.getDamage() - b.getPlayer().getArmour()));
        }

    }

    public abstract class Entity {

        private int health;
        private int mana;
        private int damage;
        private int armour;

        public Entity(int health, int mana, int damage, int armour) {
            this.health = health;
            this.mana = mana;
            this.damage = damage;
            this.armour = armour;
        }

        public abstract void attack(Battle b);

        public int getHealth() {
            return health;
        }

        public void setHealth(int health) {
            this.health = health;
        }

        public int getMana() {
            return mana;
        }

        public void setMana(int mana) {
            this.mana = mana;
        }

        public int getDamage() {
            return damage;
        }

        public void setDamage(int damage) {
            this.damage = damage;
        }

        public int getArmour() {
            return armour;
        }

        public void setArmour(int armour) {
            this.armour = armour;
        }

    }

    public abstract class Spell {

        private int tick;

        public Spell(int tick) {
            this.tick = tick;
        }

        public void cast(Battle b) {
            b.getPlayer().setMana(b.getPlayer().getMana() - this.getManaCost());
            if (this.tick > 0) {
                b.getActiveSpells().add(this);
            }

        }

        public void onTick(Battle b) {
            this.tick--;
        }

        public int getTick() {
            return tick;
        }

        public abstract int getManaCost();
    }

    public class MagicMissle extends Spell {

        public MagicMissle() {
            super(0);
        }

        @Override
        public int getManaCost() {
            return 53;
        }

        @Override
        public void cast(Battle b) {
            b.getEnemy().setHealth(b.getEnemy().getHealth() - 4);
            super.cast(b);
        }

    }

    public class Drain extends Spell {

        public Drain() {
            super(0);
        }

        @Override
        public int getManaCost() {
            return 73;
        }

        @Override
        public void cast(Battle b) {
            b.getEnemy().setHealth(b.getEnemy().getHealth() - 2);
            b.getPlayer().setHealth(b.getPlayer().getHealth() + 2);
            super.cast(b);
        }
    }

    public class Shield extends Spell {

        public Shield() {
            super(6);
        }

        @Override
        public int getManaCost() {
            return 113;
        }

        @Override
        public void onTick(Battle b) {
            if (this.getTick() == 0) {
                b.getPlayer().setArmour(0);
            } else {
                b.getPlayer().setArmour(7);
            }
            super.onTick(b);
        }

    }

    public class Poison extends Spell {

        public Poison() {
            super(6);
        }

        @Override
        public int getManaCost() {
            return 173;
        }

        @Override
        public void onTick(Battle b) {
            b.getEnemy().setHealth(b.getEnemy().getHealth() - 3);
            super.onTick(b);
        }
    }

    public class Recharge extends Spell {

        public Recharge() {
            super(5);
        }

        @Override
        public int getManaCost() {
            return 229;
        }

        @Override
        public void onTick(Battle b) {
            b.getPlayer().setMana(b.getPlayer().getMana() + 101);
            super.onTick(b);
        }
    }
}

[/spoiler]

Read full topic

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[spoiler=Day 20][code=scala]object Day20 extends App{
val input = 36000000

def part1:Int = {
var houses = Array.ofDimInt
for (e <- 1 until input) {
for(h <- e until input by e) houses(h) += e * 10
}
for(i <- 1 until houses.length) if(houses(i) >= input) return i
return -1
}
def part2:Int = {
var houses = Array.ofDimInt
for (e <- 1 until input) {
var n = 0
while(n != 50 && (n + 1 ) * e < input){
houses(n * e) += e * 11
n += 1
}
}
for(i <- 1 until houses.length) if(houses(i) >= input) return i
return -1
}
println(part1)
println(part2)
}[/code][/spoiler]

[spoiler=Day 21][code=scala]object Day21 extends App{
val shop = Source.fromFile(""“E:\advent\AdventRPG\shop”"")
val Pattern = “”"(\w+ ?+?\d?)\s*(\d+)\s*(\d+)\s*(\d+)""".r
// case class equipment(name:String, cost:Double,damage:Double,armour:Double)
case class equipment(name:String, cost:Double,stat:Double)

val items = shop.getLines().map{
case Pattern(a,b,c,d) => equipment(a,b.toDouble,c.toDouble + d.toDouble)
case _ => null
}.filter(_ != null).toArray

class PC(var life:Int,val attack:Int,val defence:Int)

def simulate(hero:PC,boss:PC): Unit ={
while(hero.life >= 0 && boss.life >= 0){
boss.life -= Math.max(hero.attack - boss.defence,0)
hero.life -= Math.max(boss.attack - hero.defence,0)
}
println(hero.life,boss.life)
}

simulate(new PC(100,7,2),new PC(104,8,1))

}[/code][/spoiler]
Day 21 is more trial and error. The code is no solution, just stuff that helped me figure this one out.

I know how to solve it, so I might add a proper solution later.

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Day 20:

[spoiler]

[code=java]
public class DayTwenty {

public static void main(String args[]) {
    int puzzleInput =34000000;
      System.out.println("part I: " + getLowestHouseIdForDeliveryTarget(puzzleInput, true));
    System.out.println("part II: " + getLowestHouseIdForDeliveryTarget(puzzleInput, false));
}

public static int getLowestHouseIdForDeliveryTarget(int target, boolean partI) {
    for (int house = 1; house < Integer.MAX_VALUE; house++) {
        int presents = 0;
        for (int elf = 1; elf <= house; elf++) {
            presents += getPresentsToDeliverByHouseId(house, elf, partI);

        }

        if (presents >= target) {
            System.out.println("house: " + house + " presentCount: " + presents);
            return house;
        }

    }
    return -1;
}

static int divisor(int number) {
    int i;
    for (i = 2; i <= Math.sqrt(number); i++) {
        if (number % i == 0) {
            return number / i;
        }
    }
    return 1;
}

public static int getPresentsToDeliverByHouseId(int houseId, int elfId, boolean partI) {
    if (houseId % elfId == 0) {
        if (!partI) {

            if (houseId / elfId > 50) {

                return 0;
            }
            return elfId * 11;
        }
        return elfId * 10;
    }
    return 0;
}

}[/code]
[/spoiler]

Read full topic

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Day 16 parts 1 and 2:

[spoiler][code=java]import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class Day16 {

static int childReq = 3;
static int catReq = 7;
static int samoyedReq = 2;
static int pomReq = 3;
static int akitaReq = 0;
static int vizReq = 0;
static int fishReq = 5;
static int treeReq = 3;
static int carReq = 2;
static int perfReq = 1;

 public static void main(String []args){
    
    populateList("input.txt");
    solvePuzzle();
    sueList = new ArrayList<AuntSue>();
    populateList("input.txt");
    solvePuzzlePartTwo();
    
 }
 
 static ArrayList<AuntSue> sueList = new ArrayList<AuntSue>();
 
 public static void solvePuzzle() {
     
     ArrayList<AuntSue> toRemove = new ArrayList<AuntSue>();
     
     for (AuntSue sue : sueList) {
         if (sue.getChildren() != childReq && sue.getChildren() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getCats() != catReq && sue.getCats() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getSamoyeds() != samoyedReq && sue.getSamoyeds() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getPomeranians() != pomReq && sue.getPomeranians() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getAkitas() != akitaReq && sue.getAkitas() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getVizslas() != vizReq && sue.getVizslas() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getGoldFish() != fishReq && sue.getGoldFish() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getTrees() != treeReq && sue.getTrees() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getCars() != carReq && sue.getCars() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getPerfumes() != perfReq && sue.getPerfumes() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
     }
     
     sueList.removeAll(toRemove);
     System.out.println("The answer to puzzle one is Aunt Sue #" + sueList.get(0).getId());
     
 }
 
 public static void solvePuzzlePartTwo() {
     
     ArrayList<AuntSue> toRemove = new ArrayList<AuntSue>();
     
     for (AuntSue sue : sueList) {
         if (sue.getChildren() != childReq && sue.getChildren() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getCats() < catReq && sue.getCats() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getSamoyeds() != samoyedReq && sue.getSamoyeds() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getPomeranians() > pomReq && sue.getPomeranians() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getAkitas() != akitaReq && sue.getAkitas() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getVizslas() != vizReq && sue.getVizslas() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getGoldFish() > fishReq && sue.getGoldFish() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getTrees() < treeReq && sue.getTrees() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getCars() != carReq && sue.getCars() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
         if (sue.getPerfumes() != perfReq && sue.getPerfumes() != 999) {
             toRemove.add(sue);
         }
     }
     
     sueList.removeAll(toRemove);
     System.out.println("The answer to puzzle two is Aunt Sue #" + sueList.get(0).getId());
     
 }
 
 public static void populateList(String fileName) {
     String currentLine;
     int id = 0;
     int children, cats, samoyeds, pomeranians, akitas, vizslas, goldfish, trees, cars, perfumes = 0;
     try {
         BufferedReader puzzle = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(fileName));
         
         while ((currentLine = puzzle.readLine()) != null) {
             id++;
             if (currentLine.contains("cars")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("cars: ");
                 cars = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 6 , indexA + 7));
             } else {
                 cars = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("children: ")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("children: ");
                 children = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 10, indexA + 11));
             } else {
                 children = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("cats")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("cats: ");
                 cats = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 6, indexA + 7));
             } else {
                 cats = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("samoyeds")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("samoyeds: ");
                 samoyeds = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 10, indexA + 11));
             } else {
                 samoyeds = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("pomeranians")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("pomeranians: ");
                 pomeranians = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 13, indexA + 14));
             } else {
                 pomeranians = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("akitas")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("akitas: ");
                 akitas = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 8, indexA + 9));
             } else {
                 akitas = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("vizslas")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("vizslas: ");
                 vizslas = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 9, indexA + 10));
             } else {
                 vizslas = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("goldfish")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("goldfish: ");
                 goldfish = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 10, indexA + 11));
             } else {
                 goldfish = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("trees")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("trees: ");
                 trees = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 7, indexA + 8));
             } else {
                 trees = 999;
             }
             if (currentLine.contains("perfumes")) {
                 int indexA = currentLine.indexOf("perfumes: ");
                 perfumes = Integer.parseInt(currentLine.substring(indexA + 10, indexA + 11));
             } else {
                 perfumes = 999;
             }
             sueList.add(new AuntSue(id, children, cats, samoyeds, pomeranians, akitas, vizslas, goldfish, trees, cars, perfumes));
         }
         
     } catch (Exception e) {
         
     }
 }

}

class AuntSue {

int id, children, cats, samoyeds, pomeranians, akitas, vizslas, goldfish, trees, cars, perfumes = 0;

public AuntSue(int id, int children, int cats, int samoyeds, int pomeranians, int akitas, int vizslas, int goldfish, int trees, int cars, int perfumes) {
    this.id = id;
    this.children = children;
    this.cats = cats;
    this.samoyeds = samoyeds;
    this.pomeranians = pomeranians;
    this.akitas = akitas;
    this.vizslas = vizslas;
    this.goldfish = goldfish;
    this.trees = trees;
    this.cars = cars;
    this.perfumes = perfumes;
}

public int getId() {
    return this.id;
}

public int getChildren() {
    return this.children;
}

public int getCats() {
    return this.cats;
}

public int getSamoyeds() {
    return this.samoyeds;
}

public int getPomeranians() {
    return this.pomeranians;
}

public int getAkitas() {
    return this.akitas;
}

public int getVizslas() {
    return this.vizslas;
} 

public int getGoldFish() {
    return this.goldfish;
}

public int getTrees() {
    return this.trees;
}

public int getCars() {
    return this.cars;
}

public int getPerfumes() {
    return this.perfumes;
}

@Override
public String toString() {
    
    return "This Aunt Sue("+id+") has " + children + " children, " + cats + " cats, " + samoyeds + " samoyeds, " + pomeranians + " pomeranians, " + akitas + " akitas, " + vizslas + " vizslas, " + goldfish + " goldfish, " + trees + " trees, " + cars + " cars, " + perfumes + " perfumes.";
    
}

}
[/code][/spoiler]

Day 19 part 1:

[spoiler][code=java]import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Set;
import java.util.HashSet;

public class Day19 {

public static void main(String[] args) {
    
    solvePuzzle();
    
}

static ArrayList<String> replacements = new ArrayList<String>();
static ArrayList<String> combinedMolecules = new ArrayList<String>();
static Set<String> uniqueMolecules = new HashSet<>();
static String startMolecule = "";

public static void solvePuzzle() {
    
    getReplacements("input.txt");
    combineMolecules(0, 0);
    
    for (String molecule : combinedMolecules) {
        uniqueMolecules.add(molecule);
    }
    
    System.out.println("A total of " + uniqueMolecules.size() + " distinct molecules can be created from string " + startMolecule + ".");
    
}


public static void getReplacements(String fileName) {
    String currentLine;
    try {
        BufferedReader puzzle = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(fileName));
        
        while ((currentLine = puzzle.readLine()) != null) {
            replacements.add(currentLine);
        }
        
    } catch (Exception e) {
        
    }
}

public static void combineMolecules(int id, int startIndex) {
    String[] split = replacements.get(id).split(" => ");
    StringBuilder newMolecule = new StringBuilder(startMolecule);
    if (startMolecule.substring(startIndex, startIndex + split[0].length()).equals(split[0])) {
        newMolecule.delete(startIndex, startIndex + split[0].length());
        newMolecule.insert(startIndex, split[1]);
        combinedMolecules.add(newMolecule.toString());
        System.out.println(startIndex);
    }

        startIndex++;
        if (startIndex < startMolecule.length() - (split[0].length()-1)) {
            combineMolecules(id, startIndex);
        } else if (id < replacements.size() - 1) {
            id++;
            startIndex = 0;
            combineMolecules(id, startIndex);
        }
}

    
}
[/code][/spoiler]

I’ll do part two when I get the chance

Read full topic

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[spoiler=Day 19][code=scala]import scala.io.Source

object Day19 extends App{
val input = Source.fromFile(""“E:\advent\input19"”")
val Pattern = “”"(\w*) => (\w*)""".r
val Pattern2 = “”".\w*""".r
var startString = ""
var replacements = List(String,String)
var permutations = SetString

input.getLines().foreach{
case Pattern(from,to) => replacements = (from,to) :: replacements
case calib:String => startString = calib
}

var sum = 0
replacements.foreach{ x =>
val occurences = x.1.r.findAllMatchIn(startString).map(.start).toList
occurences.foreach{ i =>
val part1 = startString.substring(0,i)
val part2 = startString.substring(i).replaceFirst(x._1,x._2)
permutations += part1 + part2
}
}
println(s"Part 1: ${permutations.size}")
replacements = replacements.sortBy{x=> - x._2.length}
var steps = 0
while(startString != “e”){
replacements.foreach{x => if(startString.contains(x._2)){ steps += 1; startString = startString.replaceFirst(x._2,x._1)}}
}

println(s"Part 2: $steps")
}

[/code][/spoiler]

EDIT: Part 2 added.

Read full topic

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Day 19 PART I:
[spoiler]

    public void processInstruction(String s) {
        String data[] = s.replaceAll(":", "").replaceAll(",", "").split(" ");
        if (s.contains("=>")) {
            ArrayList mols = (ArrayList) molecules.getOrDefault(data[0], new ArrayList<String>());
            mols.add(data[2]);
            molecules.put(data[0], mols);
            return;
        }
        if (s.length() == 0) {
            return;
        } else {
            this.medicine = s;
            char[] chars = s.toCharArray();
            long count = 0;
            int offset = 0;
            for (int i = 0; i < chars.length; i++) {
                String a = "" + chars[i];
                ArrayList<String> mols = (ArrayList<String>) molecules.get(a);
                if (mols != null) {

                    for (String r : mols) {

                        String result = s.substring(0, i) + s.substring(i).replaceFirst(a, r);
                        int x = results.getOrDefault(result, 0);

                        results.put(result, x++);

                    }

                } else if (i < chars.length - 1) {
                    a = "" + chars[i] + "" + chars[i + 1];
                    mols = (ArrayList<String>) molecules.get(a);
                    if (mols != null) {
                        for (String r : mols) {
                            String result = s.substring(0, i) + s.substring(i).replaceFirst(a, r);
                            int x = results.getOrDefault(result, 0);
                            results.put(result, x++);

                        }

                    }

                }
            }

            System.out.println("size: " + results.size());
        }
    }

[/spoiler]

Part II:
I didn’t check each permutation instead I opted to go from the end to the start it ended up giving me the correct answer on the first run.
[spoiler]

 private int breakMedicine() {
        String s = medicine;
        int count = 0;
        while (!s.equals("e")) {
            for (Map.Entry<String, ArrayList<String>> set : molecules.entrySet()) {
                for (String r : set.getValue()) {
                    if (s.contains(r)) {
                        s = replace(s, r, set.getKey(), s.lastIndexOf(r));
                        count++;
                    }
                }
            }
        }
        return count;
    }

    public String replace(String source, String replacement, String needle, int offset) {
      
        return source.substring(0, offset) + needle + source.substring(offset + replacement.length());
    }

[/spoiler]

edited to fix code formatting*

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I didn’t even attempt day 7…

Here’s day 8 instead

[spoiler]

[code=java]import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileReader;

public class Day8 {

static int totalInMemory = 0;
static int totalCharactersLiteral = 0;

static int totalCharactersLiteralPartTwo = 0;
static int totalAfterEncoding = 0;

public static void main(String[] args) {

    solvePuzzle("input.txt");
    System.out.println("The answer to puzzle 1 is: " + (totalCharactersLiteral - totalInMemory));
    System.out.println("The answer to puzzle 2 is: " + (totalAfterEncoding - totalCharactersLiteralPartTwo));
    
}

private static void solvePuzzle(String fileName) {
    String currentLine = null;
    try{
        BufferedReader puzzle = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(fileName));
        
        while ((currentLine = puzzle.readLine()) != null) {
            findNonCodeCharacters(currentLine);
            encodeStringForSanta(currentLine);
        }
    } catch (Exception e) {
        
    }
}

private static void findNonCodeCharacters(String currentLine) {
    int extra = 0;
    Pattern bad = Pattern.compile("\\\\\"|\\\\x|\\\\\\\\");
    Matcher detect = bad.matcher(currentLine);
        while (detect.find()) {
            //System.out.println(detect.group(0));
            extra++;
            if (detect.group(0).contains("\\x")) {
                extra += 2;
            }
        }
        //System.out.println(currentLine);
        //System.out.println("Code characters: " + currentLine.length());
        //System.out.println("Characters in memory: " + (currentLine.length() - extra - 2));
        totalInMemory += currentLine.length() - extra - 2;
        totalCharactersLiteral += currentLine.length();
    
}

private static void encodeStringForSanta(String currentLine) {
    int extra = 0;
    if (currentLine.startsWith("\"") && currentLine.substring(currentLine.length()-1, currentLine.length()).equals("\"")) {
        extra += 4;
    }
    Pattern bad = Pattern.compile("\\\\\"|\\\\x|\\\\\\\\");
    Matcher detect = bad.matcher(currentLine);
        while (detect.find()) {
            //System.out.println(detect.group(0));
            if (detect.group(0).contains("\\\"")) {
                extra += 2;
            } else if (detect.group(0).contains("\\x")) {
                extra++;
            } else if (detect.group(0).contains("\\\\")) {
                extra += 2;
            }
        }
        
        //System.out.println(currentLine);
        //System.out.println("Characters in original string: " + currentLine.length());
        //System.out.println("Characters after encoding: " + (currentLine.length() + extra));
        totalCharactersLiteralPartTwo += currentLine.length();
        totalAfterEncoding += currentLine.length() + extra;
    
    
}

}[/code][/spoiler]

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[spoiler=Day 18 - Conway’s game of light][code=scala]import scala.io.Source

object Day18 extends App {
val input = Source.fromFile(""“E:\advent\input18"”")
var isPart2 = false

def grid(x:Int)(y:Int) ={
if( isPart2 && ((x == 0 && y == 99) || (x == 0 && y == 0) || (x == 99 && y == 99) || (x == 99 && y == 0))) true
else if(x < 0 || y < 0 || x >= 100 || y >= 100) false
else _grid(x)(y)
}

def getNeighbours(x:Int)(y:Int) = {
List(
grid(x)(y+1), grid(x)(y-1),
grid(x+1)(y), grid(x+1)(y+1), grid(x+1)(y-1),
grid(x-1)(y+1), grid(x-1)(y-1), grid(x-1)(y)
).map(x=> if(x) 1 else 0).sum
}

def nextStatus(x:Int)(y:Int) = (grid(x)(y) && getNeighbours(x)(y) == 2) || getNeighbours(x)(y) == 3
val data = input.getLines().map(x => x.map(y => if(y == ‘#’) true else false).toArray).toArray
private var _grid = data

def run(n:Int) {
for (i <- 1 to n) {
_grid = _grid.zipWithIndex.map { case (a, y) => a.zipWithIndex.map { case (b, x) => nextStatus(x)(y) } }
}
}

def count = {
var out = 0
for(x <- 0 until 100; y <- 0 until 100){
if(grid(x)(y)) out += 1
}
out
}

run(100)
println(count)
isPart2 = true
_grid = data
run(100)
println(count)

}[/code][/spoiler]

Read full topic

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Still catching up… I did day 6 parts 1 and 2 today. The following code solves for both.

[spoiler][code=java]import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

public class DaySix {

public static void loadPuzzle(String fileName, List<Light> light) {
    String currentLine = null;
    try {
        BufferedReader file = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(fileName));
        
        Pattern num = Pattern.compile("\\d+");
        int totalLit = 0;
        int brightnessLevel = 0;
        int startX = 0;
        int startY = 0;
        int endX = 0;
        int endY = 0;
        
        while ((currentLine = file.readLine()) != null) {
            ArrayList<String> gridValues = new ArrayList<String>();
            Matcher m = num.matcher(currentLine);
            while (m.find()) {
                gridValues.add(m.group());
            }
            startX = Integer.parseInt(gridValues.get(0));
            startY = Integer.parseInt(gridValues.get(1));
            endX = Integer.parseInt(gridValues.get(2));
            endY = Integer.parseInt(gridValues.get(3));
            
            if (currentLine.startsWith("turn off")) {
                findRect(startX, startY, endX, endY, light, "OFF");
            } else if (currentLine.startsWith("turn on")) {
                findRect(startX, startY, endX, endY, light, "ON");
            } else {
                findRect(startX, startY, endX, endY, light, "TOGGLE");
            }
            
        }
        
        for (Light lights : light) {
            if (lights.toggle == Light.State.ON) {
                totalLit++;
            }
            brightnessLevel += lights.getBrightness();
        }
        
        System.out.println("There are " + totalLit + " lights currently lit.");
        System.out.println("The total brightness level is " + brightnessLevel + ".");
        
    } catch (Exception e) {
        
    }
}

public static void findRect(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY, List<Light> lightList, String state) {
    int totalPoints = 0;
        for (int i = startX; i <= endX; i++) {
            for (int h = startY; h <= endY; h++) {
                int listPos = (i) + h * 1000;
                totalPoints++;
                if (state.equalsIgnoreCase("ON")) {
                    lightList.get(listPos).turnOn();
                    lightList.get(listPos).setBrightness(1);
                } else if (state.equalsIgnoreCase("OFF")) {
                    lightList.get(listPos).turnOff();
                    lightList.get(listPos).setBrightness(-1);
                } else {
                    lightList.get(listPos).toggleLight();
                    lightList.get(listPos).setBrightness(2);
                }
            }
        }

}


public static void main(String[] args) {
    
    int totalLit = 0;
    int brightnessLevel = 0;
    
    List<Light> lightGrid = new ArrayList<Light>();
    
    for (int h = 0; h < 1000; h++) {
        for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
            lightGrid.add(new Light(i, h, 0, Light.State.OFF));
        }
    }
    
    System.out.println("Created light grid containing " + lightGrid.size() + " Christmas lights.");

    loadPuzzle("input.txt", lightGrid);

}

}

public class Light {

int posX;
int posY;
int brightness;

enum State {
    
    ON,
    OFF;
    
}

State toggle;

public Light(int x, int y, int brightness, State toggle) {
    
    this.posX = x;
    this.posY = y;
    this.brightness = brightness;
    this.toggle = toggle;
    
    //System.out.println("Created a light at (" + posX + ", " + posY + ") with a state of " + toggle);
    
}

public int getX() {
    return this.posX;
}

public int getY() {
    return this.posY;
}

public int getBrightness() {
    return this.brightness;
}

public void setBrightness(int intensity) {
    this.brightness = this.brightness + intensity;
    if (this.brightness < 0) {
        this.brightness = 0;
    }
}

public void turnOn() {
    this.toggle = State.ON;
}

public void turnOff() {
    this.toggle = State.OFF;
}

public void toggleLight() {
    if (this.toggle == State.ON) {
        this.toggle = State.OFF;
        //System.out.println("Light at (" + this.posX + ", " + this.posY + ") changed to OFF.");
    } else {
        this.toggle = State.ON;
        //System.out.println("Light at (" + this.posX + ", " + this.posY + ") changed to ON.");
    }
}

}
[/code][/spoiler]

Read full topic

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[spoiler=Day 16][code=scala]object Day16 extends App{
val input = Source.fromFile(""“E:\advent\input16"”")
val Pattern = “”“Sue (\d*): (\w*): (\d*), (\w*): (\d*). (\w*): (\d*)”"".r
val TickerPattern = “”"(\w*): (\d)""".r
//var tickerMap = MapString,Int
val ticker = Source.fromFile(""“E:\advent\inputticker”"")

class AuntSue(var name:String, var info:Map[String,Int]){
def this(name:String,item1:String,n1:String,item2:String,n2:String,item3:String,n3:String) = {
this(name,MapString,(Int))
info += item1 -> n1.toInt
info += item2 -> n2.toInt
info += item3 -> n3.toInt
}

override def toString = name

}

val aunts = input.getLines().map{case Pattern(sue,item1, n1, item2,n2, item3,n3)=> new AuntSue(sue,item1,n1,item2,n2,item3,n3)}.toList
//ticker.split("\n").foreach(println)
var info = ticker.getLines().map{case TickerPattern(item,number) => (item -> (number.toInt,number.toInt))}.toMap

aunts.filter{ a => a.info.forall{case(fact,n) => info(fact)._1 == n}}.foreach(println)
info += “cats” -> (info(“cats”)._1 + 1,Int.MaxValue)
info += “trees” -> (info(“trees”)._1 + 1,Int.MaxValue)
info += “pomeranians” -> (Int.MinValue,info(“pomeranians”)._2 - 1)
info += “goldfish” -> (Int.MinValue,info(“goldfish”)._2 - 1)
aunts.filter{ a => a.info.forall{case(fact,n) => n >= info(fact)._1 && n <= info(fact)._2}}.foreach(println)

}[/code][/spoiler]

item.title: Advent of Code
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:121, topic:553981”][spoiler=day15][code=scala]object Day15 extends App{
object Knapsack {
def tuplePerm(amount: Int) = {
var acc = ListList[Int]
for (i <- 0 to amount) acc = List(i, amount - i) :: acc
acc
}
def triplePerm(amount: Int) = {
var acc = ListList[Int]
for (i <- 0 to amount) tuplePerm(amount - i).foreach(x => acc = (i :: x) :: acc)
acc

}
def quadPerm(amount: Int) = {
  var acc = Set[List[Int]]()
  for (i <- 0 to amount) triplePerm(amount - i).foreach(x => acc += (i :: x))
  acc
}

}

class Ingredient(val capacity:Int,val durability:Int,val flavor:Int,val texture:Int, val cal:Int){
override def toString = s"$capacity $durability $flavor $texture $cal"
}
def getValue(l:List[Int],calorie:Int = -1) = {
val næring = l.zipWithIndex.map{case(x,i) => new Ingredient((stock(i).capacity * x),(stock(i).durability * x),(stock(i).flavor * x),(stock(i).texture * x),(stock(i).cal * x))}
val sum =
Math.max(næring.map(x=> x.capacity).sum,0) *
Math.max(næring.map(x=> x.durability).sum,0) *
Math.max(næring.map(x=> x.flavor).sum,0) *
Math.max(næring.map(x=> x.texture).sum,0)
var cal = næring.map(x=> x.cal).sum
if(cal == calorie || calorie == -1) sum else 0
}
var stock = ListIngredient
val Pattern = “”"\w*[:] capacity ([0-9-])[,] durability ([0-9-])[,] flavor ([0-9-])[,] texture ([0-9-])[,] calories (\d*)""".r
val input = Source.fromFile(""“E:\advent\input15"”")

input.getLines().foreach{case Pattern(c,d,f,t,cal) => stock = new Ingredient(c.toInt,d.toInt,f.toInt,t.toInt,cal.toInt) :: stock}
stock = stock.reverse

var permutations = Knapsack.quadPerm(100)
var part1 = permutations.map(x=> x.permutations.map(getValue()).max).max
var part2 = permutations.map(x=> x.permutations.map(getValue(,500)).max).max
println(part1)
println(part2)
}[/code][/spoiler]
This REALLY needs some improvements. As it’s currently shit.[/quote]I like how you so eloquently described yourself

#REKT
